str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
From a derivative of muo; a secret or 'mystery'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To hide away, conceal, keep secret. From apo and krupto; to conceal away; figuratively, to keep secret.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular

str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To foreordain, predetermine, mark out beforehand. From pro and horizo; to limit in advance, i.e. predetermine.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
